description:
If Twitter allows a majority of users to edit Tweets by June 30, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The ability to edit a Tweet means a user can edit the text within a tweet, for any length of time after it is published to their timeline. For example, if the tweets are only editable for 5 seconds after being published, it will count.

If a new Twitter account can be made and has access to the edit feature, it will suffice to resolve this market to “Yes.” 

If the ability for the majority of users to edit Tweets is instituted for any length of time, this market will resolve to "Yes”, regardless of whether the editing ability is later removed.

For the purpose of settling this market, an announcement that users will have the ability to edit Tweets within the market timeframe will not be sufficient to resolve this market to "Yes". This market will only resolve to "Yes" if the majority of users are granted the ability to edit Tweets within the market timeframe.

The resolution source for this market is https://www.twitter.com.

events.title: Will Twitter add an edit button by June 30?

question: Will Twitter add an edit button by June 30?
